title: A Woman's Story About a Prince
summary: A lawyer says a woman claims she was sent to the UK by Jeffrey Epstein to meet Prince Andrew for a sexual encounter in 2010. She was in her 20s and not from the UK. The meeting happened at Prince Andrew's home called Royal Lodge. After spending the night, she says she got a tour of Buckingham Palace and had tea. The BBC asked Prince Andrew for his side, but he has not replied yet. The lawyer works for many people who say they were hurt by Epstein, including Virginia Giuffre, who also accused Prince Andrew. Epstein was a man who went to jail for a crime with a young girl. Prince Andrew lost his royal titles last year, and the lawyer says this makes it hard for the women to get help.

a meeting for private adult activities
a big house in London where the king lives
special names and honors given to royal people

background_read: This story is about accusations against Prince Andrew, who is part of the British royal family. Jeffrey Epstein was a wealthy man who was convicted of crimes involving young girls and is linked to many people saying they were hurt. Royal titles are special honors that can be taken away if someone behaves badly. The BBC is a news company reporting on this to share information.
Article_Structure: WHO: A woman and her lawyer Brad Edwards, Prince Andrew, Jeffrey Epstein
WHAT: The woman claims she was sent for a sexual encounter with Prince Andrew and got a palace tour
WHERE: Royal Lodge in the UK and Buckingham Palace
WHY: To report on new accusations and how Prince Andrew lost his titles, making it hard for victims to get help

perspectives.description: She says she was sent by Epstein for a bad experience with Prince Andrew and wants people to know her story.
He has not responded to deny the accusations and lost his titles, which might affect how he is seen.
